So said  douchebag_ca  on  2002-12-03 

>--- In junit@y..., "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbr@d...> wrote:
>> --- In junit@y..., "Wolfgang Egger" <beuys@b...> wrote:
>> > Servus Nahan,
>> > 
>> > I  know that this is the "pure doctrine". But what do you do, if
you
>> > have a series of dependent test (some interaction between two 
>> systems)
>> > that need a defined protocoll and therefor a defined order?
>> >  
>> 
>> If you need the tests to run in a certain order, build the test
suite 
>> yourself.
>> 
>> Remember, folks: naming your test methods "testSomething()" is ONLY
a 
>> NAMING CONVENTION to help JUnit create test suites automatically. 
>> Otherwise, build the test suite yourself!
>> 
>> See my article JUnit: A Starter Guide for details.
>
>See http://sourceforge.net/projects/gsbase OrderedTestSuite for a
>solution that enables you to specify the order of some tests while
>using reflection to ensure no tests are missed.

Yes. Mike and I found the need for it one day and, conscientious as he
is, he wrote it that night. :)
